content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-094-05-B
|Item_parent=Rachialgia
|Item_parent_short=Rachialgia
|Rank=B
|Title=Knowing the risk factors for spinal pain
|Description=List of risk factors to look for
|Rubric=Epidemiology
|Contributors=Bisseriex Hélène,Nguyen Christelle
|Order=5}}

===''Factors associated with low back pain and neck pain''===

* Repeated trauma or microtrauma, prolonged postures in leisure or work '''[[Occupational risk prevention SDD-315|(occupational risk prevention,]] ''[[Identify the consequences of a pathology/situation on maintaining a job SDD-316|identify the consequences of a pathology/situation on maintaining a job)]]''''
* sedentary lifestyle
* obesity (low back pain only)
* spinal static disorders ''[[Spinal deformity SDD-065|(spinal deformity)]]'''''
* smoking
* family history

question.title: What is a risk factor for low back pain and neck pain?

option_a.title: Repetitive strain injuries
option_a.description: Injuries caused by repeated strain on a specific part of the body

option_b.title: Genetic predisposition
option_b.description: A person's genetic makeup that may affect their susceptibility to certain conditions
